text: Hi! I have just emailed you!

Hello everyone,

How can I fetch data from one hubdb table and store that response data in another hubdb table having different portal Id? The purpose here is to transfer data from one portal to another using HubSpot APIs.
Maybe with this? <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/cms/hubdb>

How to run NodeJs file on HubSpot portal?
Found the solution, need to create a public app for this.
you can't
Any alternatives? I want to fetch data from another HubSpot portal and feed it into another. The code is in NodeJs

You would use <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/data/serverless-functions|serverless functions> for that. Depending on your needs you may also be able to do workflows to do the same thing.

What depends is how your node code is written. Serverless functions are designed to stop running once the work is done, then get called again as needed.

If you need a persistently running app, then you’ll need to build an app, we have nodejs client library that can help  <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/overview>
does anyone have experience with CSP (Content-Security-Policy) and how nonce works in HubSpot, that is willing to help and point us in the direction? newbies here.

If you are not using Themes, then the module CSS will always load first. But you can do this - Create a global module and add the CSS font declaration inside it. Then add this global module as the first module in every template. This way your CSS font declaration will always load before the CSS of other custom modules and template stylesheets, on all pages.

Hello everyone! I'm trying to connect my Drupal HubSpot module to my HS developer app, but keep getting the error message "Insufficient scopes were provided. Please contact the app developer." I have checked my scopes in the return URL and it's listing the two that I have in the app. Anyone else running into this issue?
Does the /all page now limit to 200 posts? :grimacing::grimacing::grimacing::grimacing:
:point_up_2: Seems like this is the case. Which is really nasty — Is there no longer a way to get more than 200 posts using at hubl? <@U7SL518D6> <@U26BLKGE4> <@U3T21PDBK> <@U2H3TT8F2> <@UD53A9UUR>
Is there a way to bulk upload pages to a sitemap? Through the UI, there’s only an option to add a single page.
serverless fn to query and write all post titles+links to a hubdb table and output with hubdb function???
that’s like going around your elbow to scratch your arse though

Non enterprise clients :confused: our solution is to make recursive ajax calls to `/blog/page/(page + 1)`  and grab a hubl formatted json object on that page — then concat them all togehter… An even more roundabout but portal agnostic solution to grabbing all posts… Kind of lame that there isnt a way to just grab them all.
Yeah that’s definitely waaaay simpler anyways and the route I’d go (Wasn’t sure if clientside js was off limits or not)
and yeah that’s frustrating
Appreciate the insights and thoughts!
I’ve done the page-scraping thing before, and it can work pretty well especially when combined with infinite scrolling
Has there been any news or updates lately about blog post drag-n-drop functionality or custom breakpoint support? I know both have been “in progress” for a while.
We have not put out any recent announcements about it. We hear the feedback. Not hearing something doesn’t mean we’re not thinking on/working on something.
Right, sorry, I wasn’t trying to imply that; I was just curious if anything had been said about progress being made or it being delayed further. Thanks for the reply.
Does anyone know if there was a recent update for HubSpot Sales Quotes on Jul 1? I have a client saying the functionality has changed and have 404 errors on quotes.

Need help troubleshooting a HubSpot form! I'm receiving an error message "This form is no longer current. Please refresh the page and try again." HubSpot Support thinks there might be some custom script on the page causing the error with the form, but they do not have all the resources to be able to troubleshoot the error. I'm just not sure what needle I'm looking for. It's a HubSpot form on a HubSpot landing page. I tried creating a new form and swapping it - still seeing the error. I tried several other forms/landing pages - no error. I tried cloning a landing page with no error and inserting the form - seeing the error. I tried the same form in a standalone format - no error. Would love help trying to diagnose! <https://ride.oaklandh-d.com/win-2>
